solution.text:
Total surface area \(= 726= 6 (side)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Length of side = \( \left(\sqrt {\frac {726}{6}} \right) = 11 cm\)

content.text: A closed box in the shape of a cube has a total outer surface area of 726 \(cm^2.\) What is the length of its side in centimetres?

hint.text: Remember that surface area of a cube is \(6 \times side^2\)

solution.text: Surface Area of a cube = \(6 \times length^2 = 1350 cm^2\)

solution.text: Surface Area of a cuboid = \(2(ab + bc + ca) = 2 (882 + 294 + 588) = 3528 dm^2\)

content.text: See the cuboid below, a=42 dm, b=21 dm, c=14 dm, Find its surface area

solution.text: Surface Area of a cylinder = \(2 \times \pi \times r \times(r + h) = 2145 cm^2\)

content.text: In the cylinder below, diameter=35 cm, h=2 cm, find its surface area

solution.text:
Surface Area = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2\pi ({r_ o}^2 - {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 1056 + 528 + 75.43 = 1659.43 cm^2\)

Surface Area of the Cuboid: \(2 \times (lb + bh + lh)\)
Surface area of a cylinder:\(2\pi r(r+h)\)

solution.text:
Curved Surface area of the roller \(= 2 \pi rh = 2\pi \times \frac {10}2 \times 20 = 628.57 cm^2\)
Area covered per rotation \(= 628.57 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area painted in 58 rolls \(= 628.57 \times 58 = 36457.14 cm^2\)

content.text: Last Monday, Ram painted a rectangular wall with a cylindrical paint roller. The length of the roller is 20 cm and its diameter is 10 cm. While painting, the roller rolled over 58 times completely. What surface area did Ram paint?

hint.text: How much area does the roller cover in one rotation?

solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times 2.7^2 = 218.7 cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(2.7^2 cm^2 = 7.29 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = 218.7 - 72.9 = 145.8 \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs 10 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(145.8 \times 10\)
= Rs. 1458

content.text: Five cubes of edge 2.7 cm each are placed side by side and stuck together as shown. The cost of painting is Rs 10 per \(cm^2\). What is the cost of painting the outer surface of the entire object?

hint.text: Count the number of faces that are outward facing

solution.text:
The surface area of the box \(= 2 (34 \times 13 + 13 \times 7 + 34 \times 7) = 1542 cm^2\)
Cost of painting the box = Rs. 2.8 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the box = \(1542 \times 2.8\)
= Rs. 4317.6

content.text: Latika needs to paint a rectangular box from the outside. The cost of painting the box is Rs. 2.8 per \(cm^2.\) If the dimensions of the box are \(34 cm \times 13 cm \times 7 cm\), what is the total cost of painting the box?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area

content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 936 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(936 m^2\)
Therefore, \(936 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{936}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{9}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 3 metres

content.text: What is the Height of the cuboid?

hint.text: Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2 (lb + bh + lh)\)

solution.text:
Area of tin sheet required for 1 box = Surface area of one box
\(= 2 (10 \times 9 + 9 \times 4 + 10 \times 4) = 332 cm^2\)
Therefore, area of tin required for 6 boxes \(= 332 \times 6\)
\(= 1992 cm^2\)

content.text: You need to create a tin box of dimensions \(10 cm \times 9 cm \times 4 cm.\) What is the area of a sheet of tin required to make 6 such tins?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area of the box
